ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course provided clear, in-depth, and well-organized insights in to jewish philosophy. I feel like i have gained a true grounding in the basics of the field

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course could probably have used a little bit more interactivity in the seminar sections. Class involvement definitely varied a lot, and I think all of the students would have benefitted more if a little bit more engagement was required.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this class, however, be prepared to learn as much as you are willing to put into it. Not a lot of work is required, but a lot of material is prepared and given to you. We only covered small fractions of the total material in class, but there is a great wealth of knowledge available.
Yes! If you are at all interested in philosophy or judaism, take jewish philosophy with professor franks! He is wonderfully clear and really challenges you!
